cards.flavor: The continent of Bala Ged was ravaged by massive Eldrazi of Ulamog's lineage, its lush jungles and cascading rivers reduced to dust.
cards.name: Bane of Bala Ged
cards.text: Whenever Bane of Bala Ged attacks, defending player exiles two permanents he or she controls.

cards.name: Blight Herder
cards.text: When you cast Blight Herder, you may put two cards your opponents own from exile into their owners' graveyards. If you do, create three 1/1 colorless Eldrazi Scion creature tokens. They have "Sacrifice this creature: Add {C} to your mana pool."

cards.flavor: "There are some who have lost everyone and everything. They actively seek out the Eldrazi, eager for the smallest measure of vengeance."—Munda, ambush leader
cards.name: Breaker of Armies
cards.text: All creatures able to block Breaker of Armies do so.

cards.name: Conduit of Ruin
cards.text:
When you cast Conduit of Ruin, you may search your library for a colorless creature card with converted mana cost 7 or greater, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
The first creature spell you cast each turn costs {2} less to cast.

cards.flavor: "Over and over it rose. Over and over we fell."—Ganda, Goma Fada deserter
cards.name: Deathless Behemoth
cards.text:
Vigilance
Sacrifice two Eldrazi Scions: Return Deathless Behemoth from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.flavor: "With precise coordination and enough blood spilled, one can be driven off, even brought down. But two . . . that's a lot of blood."—Munda, ambush leader
cards.name: Desolation Twin
cards.text: When you cast Desolation Twin, create a 10/10 colorless Eldrazi creature token.

cards.flavor: "No matter how big your champion, theirs is bigger. No matter how great your numbers, theirs are greater. No matter how voracious your appetite, they are hungrier. That is why the Eldrazi will win."—Kalitas, thrall of Ulamog
cards.name: Eldrazi Devastator
cards.text: Trample

cards.flavor: It embodies all possible meanings of the word "infinite."
cards.name: Endless One
cards.text: Endless One enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.flavor: Though Gideon arrived at Sea Gate too late to prevent the massacre, he still had enough time to lead its survivors to relative safety.
cards.name: Gruesome Slaughter
cards.text: Until end of turn, colorless creatures you control gain "{T}: This creature deals damage equal to its power to target creature."

cards.flavor: "In the dark places of our world, something horrible is growing. I fear our foes may be more numerous than we had imagined."—Nissa Revane
cards.name: Kozilek's Channeler
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: The Eldrazi hunger without limit and consume without pause.
cards.name: Oblivion Sower
cards.text: When you cast Oblivion Sower, target opponent exiles the top four cards of his or her library, then you may put any number of land cards that player owns from exile onto the battlefield under your control.

cards.flavor: The Eldrazi continue to sweep through the wastes, compounding destruction that already seemed absolute.
cards.name: Ruin Processor
cards.text: When you cast Ruin Processor, you may put a card an opponent owns from exile into that player's graveyard. If you do, you gain 5 life.

cards.flavor: "Our people and our very lands disappear as if they never were. We no longer fight for glory, or honor. We battle now for the right to exist."—General Tazri, allied commander
cards.name: Scour from Existence
cards.text: Exile target permanent.

cards.flavor: Dust and memory are all that remain in Ulamog's wake.
cards.name: Titan's Presence
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Titan's Presence, reveal a colorless creature card from your hand.
Exile target creature if its power is less than or equal to the revealed card's power.

cards.flavor: A force as voracious as time itself.
cards.name: Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger
cards.text:
When you cast Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, exile two target permanents.
Indestructible
Whenever Ulamog attacks, defending player exiles the top twenty cards of his or her library.

cards.name: Ulamog's Despoiler
cards.text: As Ulamog's Despoiler enters the battlefield, you may put two cards your opponents own from exile into their owners' graveyards. If you do, Ulamog's Despoiler enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.flavor: "Have you ever seen a world fall to its knees? Watch, and learn."—Ob Nixilis
cards.name: Void Winnower
cards.text:
Your opponents can't cast spells with even converted mana costs. (Zero is even.)
Your opponents can't block with creatures with even converted mana costs.

cards.flavor: "No more fear. No more failure. No more death. No more!"
cards.name: Angel of Renewal
cards.text:
Flying

cards.flavor: "Zendikar will triumph this day, and our armies will fly with angels."

Enchant creature

Flying
